title: Eringya's Formal Garden
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                          |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Strewn with twigs and leaves that crunch loudly underfoot, the grass is crisp and fresh. |

**Eringya's Formal Garden** is a [Wizard Laboratory](/Wizard_Laboratory "Wizard Laboratory") made of [bushes](/Bush "Bush"), [trees](/Tree "Tree"), and tasteful statuary. Its map is a fairly simple series of shrub-lined pathways, with a portal out just next to the entrance and a pair of fairly obvious guarded treasure chambers behind [doors](/Door "Door").

## Contents

- [1 Summary](#Summary)
- [2 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [3 Map](#Map)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 History](#History)

## Summary

Expect heavy ranged resistance: from [centaur](/List_of_centaurs "List of centaurs") and [satyr](/Satyr "Satyr") defenders, to [eleionoma](/Eleionoma "Eleionoma") and [thorn hunters](/Thorn_hunter "Thorn hunter"). The massive amount of ranged damage can be scary to frailer characters, so [repulsion](/Repulsion "Repulsion") and [shields](/Shield "Shield") are quite useful.

One of the two treasure chambers will contain a variety of [spellbooks](/Spellbook "Spellbook") and [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves"), which will be guarded by two [oklob plants](/Oklob_plant "Oklob plant"). The other will contain an [altar](/Altar "Altar") to [Fedhas Madash](/Fedhas_Madash "Fedhas Madash"), along with [spectral](/Spectral "Spectral") weapons, including a [lajatang](/Lajatang "Lajatang").

## Origin

While modern *Crawl* players may know Eringya from [Eringya's Noxious Bog](/Eringya%27s_Noxious_Bog "Eringya's Noxious Bog"), this wizlab predates the spell by over 5 years. Instead, it references [Eringya's Surprising Bouquet](/Eringya%27s_Surprising_Bouquet "Eringya's Surprising Bouquet"), which was removed in a very early version. The Surprising Bouquet transmuted any wooden item in your hands into a vaguely [edible](/Food "Food") bouquet of flowers. Other than potentially ridding you of a [cursed](/Curse "Curse") item or keeping [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") from starvation, it was useless.

## History

- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Eringya's Formal Garden will contain a stack of [potions of lignification](/Potions_of_lignification "Potions of lignification") or [scrolls of poison](/Scrolls_of_poison "Scrolls of poison"), and guarantee the spell [Eringya's Noxious Bog](/Eringya%27s_Noxious_Bog "Eringya's Noxious Bog"). Also, monsters won't drink the potions, increasing loot overall.
- This laboratory was re-introduced and reworked in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28").
- This laboratory was retired as of [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"). The original version had vine-covered [earth elementals](/Earth_elemental "Earth elemental"), and custom script which would block your path with [wandering mushrooms](/Wandering_mushroom "Wandering mushroom") and drop [fruit](/Fruit "Fruit").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the altar of Fedhas Madash was guarded by **vine-covered golems**, which were essentially [stone golems](/Stone_golem "Stone golem").
html:
Eringya's Formal Garden

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Strewn with twigs and leaves that crunch loudly underfoot, the grass is crisp and fresh.

Eringya's Formal Garden is a Wizard Laboratory made of bushes, trees, and tasteful statuary. Its map is a fairly simple series of shrub-lined pathways, with a portal out just next to the entrance and a pair of fairly obvious guarded treasure chambers behind doors.

Contents

  • 1 Summary
  • 2 Monsters
  • 3 Map
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 History

Summary

Expect heavy ranged resistance: from centaur and satyr defenders, to eleionoma and thorn hunters. The massive amount of ranged damage can be scary to frailer characters, so repulsion and shields are quite useful.

One of the two treasure chambers will contain a variety of spellbooks and magical staves, which will be guarded by two oklob plants. The other will contain an altar to Fedhas Madash, along with spectral weapons, including a lajatang.

Monsters

c Centaur warrior c Yaktaur c Faun c Satyr
e Deep elf archer e Deep elf master archer N Naga sharpshooter R Eleionoma
f Shambling mangrove f Thorn hunter H Fenstrider witch P Oklob plant

Map

ccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc

Origin

While modern Crawl players may know Eringya from Eringya's Noxious Bog, this wizlab predates the spell by over 5 years. Instead, it references Eringya's Surprising Bouquet, which was removed in a very early version. The Surprising Bouquet transmuted any wooden item in your hands into a vaguely edible bouquet of flowers. Other than potentially ridding you of a cursed item or keeping spriggans from starvation, it was useless.

History

  • In 0.31, Eringya's Formal Garden will contain a stack of potions of lignification or scrolls of poison, and guarantee the spell Eringya's Noxious Bog. Also, monsters won't drink the potions, increasing loot overall.
  • This laboratory was re-introduced and reworked in 0.28.
  • This laboratory was retired as of 0.17. The original version had vine-covered earth elementals, and custom script which would block your path with wandering mushrooms and drop fruit.
  • Prior to 0.14, the altar of Fedhas Madash was guarded by vine-covered golems, which were essentially stone golems.

{{version030}} {{flavour|Strewn with twigs and leaves that crunch loudly underfoot, the grass is crisp and fresh.}} '''Eringya's Formal Garden''' is a [[Wizard Laboratory]] made of [[bush]]es, [[tree]]s, and tasteful statuary. Its map is a fairly simple series of shrub-lined pathways, with a portal out just next to the entrance and a pair of fairly obvious guarded treasure chambers behind [[door]]s. ==Summary== Expect heavy ranged resistance: from [[list of centaurs|centaur]] and [[satyr]] defenders, to [[eleionoma]] and [[thorn hunter]]s. The massive amount of ranged damage can be scary to frailer characters, so [[repulsion]] and [[shield]]s are quite useful. One of the two treasure chambers will contain a variety of [[spellbook]]s and [[magical staves]], which will be guarded by two [[oklob plant]]s. The other will contain an [[altar]] to [[Fedhas Madash]], along with [[spectral]] weapons, including a [[lajatang]]. ==Monsters== {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;" | {{monsterlink|Centaur warrior}} | {{monsterlink|Yaktaur}} | {{monsterlink|Faun}} | {{monsterlink|Satyr}} |- | {{monsterlink|Deep elf archer}} | {{monsterlink|Deep elf master archer}} | {{monsterlink|Naga sharpshooter}} | {{monsterlink|Eleionoma}} |- | {{monsterlink|Shambling mangrove}} | {{monsterlink|Thorn hunter}} | {{monsterlink|Fenstrider witch}} | {{monsterlink|Oklob plant}} |- |} ==Map== [[File:Eringya_minimap_0.29.png]]

==Origin== While modern ''Crawl'' players may know Eringya from [[Eringya's Noxious Bog]], this wizlab predates the spell by over 5 years. Instead, it references [[Eringya's Surprising Bouquet]], which was removed in a very early version. The Surprising Bouquet transmuted any wooden item in your hands into a vaguely [[food|edible]] bouquet of flowers. Other than potentially ridding you of a [[curse]]d item or keeping [[spriggan]]s from starvation, it was useless. ==History== *In [[0.31]], Eringya's Formal Garden will contain a stack of [[potions of lignification]] or [[scrolls of poison]], and guarantee the spell [[Eringya's Noxious Bog]]. Also, monsters won't drink the potions, increasing loot overall. *This laboratory was re-introduced and reworked in [[0.28]]. *This laboratory was retired as of [[0.17]]. The original version had vine-covered [[earth elemental]]s, and custom script which would block your path with [[wandering mushroom]]s and drop [[fruit]]. *Prior to [[0.14]], the altar of Fedhas Madash was guarded by '''vine-covered golems''', which were essentially [[stone golem]]s.
